comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: 

Once a persist="elementAttribute" was added to an element and some data recorded into localstore.rdf, this data will be used even after persist persist="elementAttribute" was removed from that element.
It also seems to impossible to remove that stored data by setting persist attribute to blank or to non-existing attribute

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a window with 3 tabs, in <tabbox> add persist="selectedIndex" and selectedIndex="0"
2. open that window and select second tab
3. close window and remove persist="selectedIndex" or set it to some other attribute: persist="noattributeexists"
4. open that window again
Actual Results:  
4. it will automatically select second tab

Expected Results:  
4. it should select first tab.

it should ignore or even delete stored persist data if no persist attribute is set or if stored attribute name doesn't match current persist attribute of the element.
